description: The underlying cause of the reported issue appears to be the deployment of an incorrect printer driver by HP, possibly through a Windows Update targeting 'local printer' instead of the specific hardware ID for the device. This misconfiguration leads to the existing drivers being partially replaced, while the new driver necessitates an additional HP application, which can automatically install if the Microsoft Store is enabled. Users deploying printer drivers manually may face significant challenges and potential system malfunctions due to this issue. The problem highlights the balance between security and convenience, as disabling the flawed driver might disrupt system functionality. It is imperative for system administrators to monitor Windows Update behaviors closely, especially for unmanaged or stray devices that may introduce unforeseen complications.
